name: Mass Protest Escalation - Athens City Center
description: A large-scale peaceful protest in Syntagma Square has escalated into widespread civil unrest across central Athens. Over 50,000 protesters have clashed with police. Violence has spread to surrounding streets with reports of property damage, arson, and looting. Multiple injuries reported among protesters, police, and bystanders. Transportation is disrupted, businesses damaged, and there are concerns about further escalation. Emergency services are struggling to access affected areas.

available_actions.name: De-escalation Through Dialogue and Concessions
available_actions.description: Engage protest leaders in immediate dialogue, make public concessions, withdraw riot police from confrontational positions, allow peaceful assembly

available_actions.name: Controlled Crowd Dispersal Operations
available_actions.description: Deploy riot control units to systematically disperse crowds using non-lethal methods, establish security perimeters, restore order

available_actions.name: Containment and Area Isolation
available_actions.description: Establish containment perimeters, prevent spread to other areas, allow protest in designated zones, protect critical infrastructure

available_actions.name: Priority Emergency Services and Medical Response
available_actions.description: Focus on establishing safe corridors for emergency services, medical treatment for injured, fire suppression, protecting civilians while minimizing confrontation

available_actions.name: Comprehensive Public Order Management
available_actions.description: Multi-faceted approach: immediate dialogue and de-escalation attempts, emergency service corridors, strategic containment, proportional enforcement, media communication strategy

additional_concerns: Risk of further escalation if force used
Protest may spread to other cities
Businesses in area unable to operate
